You are my wife. Therefore, in return for the love I have for you, I consider that love to be a reward and I should give you some property. The property as per the schedule below is my ancestral property, that is, the property of my ancestral family, which was divided between me, my father and my brothers in 1985–year. The property was my share in the previous marriage when I was a minor and has been in my complete possession since that date. The property as per the Schedule below, as per the rights, is hereby transferred to you free of charge on this day without any consideration and the said Schedule property is hereby taken over by you on this day. Therefore, from now on, you shall pay the taxes due to the Government and shall enjoy the same freely and freely with all the rights of donation, donation and sale as you wish, and your sons, grandsons and descendants shall enjoy it freely and freely. I hereby agree that, whatever encumbrances may arise from time to time, I, my heirs and my subjects, will settle them at my own expense and grant to you, your heirs and subjects, your subjects and subjects, and you shall be able to exercise the property as per the Schedule below. In the meantime, This settlement deed is made in your name, having sincerely believed and believed that this property is an undisputed property free from any mortgages, sales, purchase agreements, guarantees, court seizures, wills, donations, etc., and that there is no other rightful owner of this property except me. The 9/77 Act does not apply to this. I have given you a property situated in Somavaram village, Kirlampudi mandal, free of charge, and I have registered it in your name in the office of the Sub-Registrar, Sri Jaggampet, as Deed No. 255/2026 on 24-01-2026. Since then, you have been enjoying the said property with full rights. In the said settlement document, the details like survey number, area etc. were all written correctly, but due to a clerical error, the boundary of the property as per the schedule was written as "C.C. Road" instead of "Ganta Ramulu Gari's house" and instead of writing "Ganta Ramulu Gari's house", it was written as "Southern boundary" and instead of writing "66" as "C.C. Road" Road” was registered incorrectly.

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 255 of 2026, dated 24/Jan/2026, executed by Guthurthi Krupanandam in favour of his Wife, Gurthurthi Lakshmi towards the property admeasuring an extent of 146.25 Sq. Yds., Located Near By House No. 1-131/1, comprised in survey number 206/1A, situated in Somavaram Village & Grama Panchayati, Kirlampudi Mandal, Erstwhile East Godavari Now within the District of Kakinada, registered at sub-registrar office Jaggampeta, is bounded as follows: Boundires As Per Deed North by: 39 Ft House Of Ganta Ramulu South by: 39 Ft C.C Road East by: 33 Ft 9 Inches House Of Pattem Subbarao West by: 33 Ft 9 Inches House Of Gurthurthi Venkateswararao Boundires As Per Rectification Deed North by: 39 Ft C.C Road South by: 39 Ft House Of Ganta Ramulu East by: 33.9 Ft House Of Pattem Subbarao West by: 33.9 Ft House Of Gurthurthi Venkateswararao
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
